classes.cCustomNote: One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, C3, C4, C1-C5 elective, D1, D2, D3, D4, D5 and F. C4, D5 and F should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP) and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C3, C4, D1, D3, D4, D5 or F.

A total of 5-9 units of elective credit are required for this major/concentration combination. The Chemistry Department strongly recommends that you take CHEM101, offered only in Fall quarter, and SCM150 for Math and Science elective credit in your first year.
